DOC.brief_summary: This study open-label , randomize , single dose , three way partial crossover study healthy male subject . The aim study evaluate bioequivalence fix dose combination ( FDC ) capsule dutasteride tamsulosin hydrochloride ( HCl ) ( 0.5 milligram [ mg ] /0.4 mg ) relative co-administration dutasteride 0.5 mg capsule tamsulosin hydrochloride 0.4 mg tablet feed fasted state . Approximately 98 healthy adult male subject enrol study . Subjects receive single oral dos 3 treatment period randomize one twelve different treatment sequence ( ABC , ACB , BAC , BCA , CAB , CBA , ABD , ADB , BAD , BDA , DAB , DBA ) wherein A= commercially available tamsulosin hydrochloride 0.4 mg dutasteride 0.5 mg fed state , B= fix dose combination formulation dutasteride tamsulosin hydrochloride ( 0.5 mg dutasteride , 0.4 mg tamsulosin hydrochloride ) fed state , C= commercially available tamsulosin hydrochloride 0.4 mg dutasteride 0.5 mg fast state , D= fix dose combination formulation dutasteride tamsulosin hydrochloride ( 0.5 mg dutasteride , 0.4 mg tamsulosin hydrochloride ) fast state . Each treatment period separate minimum 28 day washout period . The total duration subject 's involvement study approximately 15-18 week .
DOC.brief_title: A Study To Compare Giving AVODART And FLOMAX Together Or In A Combination Capsule In The Fed And Fasted State
DOC.detailed_description: An Open-Label , Randomized , Single Dose Three-Period Partial Crossover Study Determine Bioequivalence Food Effect Combination Capsule Formulation Dutasteride Tamsulosin Hydrochloride ( 0.5mg/0.4mg ) Compared Concomitant Dosing AVODART 0.5mg FLOMAX 0.4mg Commercial Capsules Healthy Male Subjects
